para.p: Tendency to see the ampersand before aligned has started
Equation with split; Ampersand before relation
Align with split. Notice that the split acts like a column pair in the align.

Math.text: C = (- D) + E + F + G + H + I
C = (- D) + E + F + G + H + I

para.p: 2-Column align with split; Note that you should omit double slash from last line of split!
Multiple splits in multicolumn align. Note how each split block contributes to a single row, but it is horizontally aligned as if it were a column pair in the align.

Math.text: (E + e + f + g = F + G) * (L = M + N + Z)
E + e + f + g = F + G
